member.summary: Gets the chord symbol suffix for display.

member.summary: Parses a chord quality from a symbol string.

member.summary: Represents a chord as a set of pitch classes with a root and quality.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Collections.Chord.Bass
member.summary: The bass note (for inversions/slash chords). Null means root is bass.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Collections.Chord.PitchClasses
member.summary: The pitch classes in this chord.

member.summary: Gets the inversion of this chord (rotates the bass note).

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Collections.Chord.Transpose(System.Int32)
member.summary: Transposes the chord by the given interval.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Collections.Chord.Parse(System.String)
member.summary: Parses a chord from a symbol string (e.g., "Am", "G7", "Dm/F").

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Collections.ModePatterns

member.summary: Gets whether a mode is considered "major" (has a major third).

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Collections.ModePatterns.Parse(System.String)
member.summary: Parses a mode type from a string.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Collections.Scale
member.summary: Represents a musical scale - a set of pitches within an octave starting from a root.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Collections.Scale.Root
member.summary: The root pitch class of the scale.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Collections.Scale.Mode
member.summary: The mode (interval pattern) of the scale.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Collections.Scale.PitchClasses
member.summary: The pitch classes in this scale.

member.summary: Gets the scale degree (1-based) for a pitch class, or null if not in scale.

member.summary: Gets all pitches in this scale within a given range.
member.returns: All scale pitches within the range.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Collections.Scale.GetParallel
member.summary: Gets the parallel major/minor scale (same root, different mode).

member.summary: Creates a close-position voicing of a chord.

member.summary: Creates a drop-2 voicing (second voice from top dropped an octave). Common in jazz guitar and piano.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Collections.Voicing.GetIntervalBetween(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the interval between two adjacent voices.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Collections.Voicing.HasLargeSpacing
member.summary: Checks if this voicing has any spacing larger than an octave between adjacent voices (except possibly between bass and tenor, which is allowed).

member.summary: Transposes all pitches in the voicing.

member.summary: Factory for creating common voicing patterns.

member.summary: Harmonic function categories in tonal harmony.

member.summary: Subdominant function - pre-dominant, moves away from tonic

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Harmony.HarmonicFunctionType.Dominant
member.summary: Dominant function - tension, resolves to tonic

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Harmony.HarmonicFunction
member.summary: Represents a harmonic function with its typical chords and tendencies.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Harmony.HarmonicFunction.IsPrimary
member.summary: Whether this is a primary (I, IV, V) or secondary (ii, iii, vi, vii) function.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Harmony.HarmonicFunction.TypicalResolutions
member.summary: Typical resolution targets (degrees that this chord tends to move to).

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Harmony.HarmonicFunction.Major
member.summary: Scale degree functions in major keys.

member.summary: Gets the function for a given scale degree.

member.summary: Scale degree functions in minor keys.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Harmony.HarmonicFunction.Minor.ForDegree(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the function for a given scale degree.

member.summary: Gets the diatonic chord for this function in a given scale.

member.summary: Analyzes harmonic function of chords in context.

member.summary: Leap not resolved by step in opposite direction

member.summary: Require large leaps to resolve by step.

member.summary: Weight for very large leaps (> P5).

member.summary: Selects an interval size based on preferences.

member.summary: Normalized density from 0 (very sparse) to 1 (very dense).

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Melody.DensityAnalysis.ActivityRatio
member.summary: Percentage of time with active notes (vs. rests).

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Melody.DensityCategory.VerySparse
member.summary: Very sparse with long notes and rests (less than 0.5 notes/beat)

member.name: F:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Melody.DensityCategory.VeryDense
member.summary: Very dense with many short notes (more than 4 notes/beat)

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Pitch.Interval
member.summary: Represents a musical interval as a number of semitones. Provides named constants for common intervals and operations.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Pitch.Interval.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates an interval with the specified number of semitones.
member.param: Number of semitones (can be negative for descending).

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Pitch.Interval.Tritone
member.summary: Tritone / Augmented fourth / Diminished fifth (6 semitones)

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Pitch.Interval.Simple
member.summary: Gets the simple interval (reduced to within one octave).

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Pitch.Interval.IntervalClass
member.summary: Gets the interval class (0-6, representing the shortest distance). Used for set theory analysis.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Pitch.Interval.IsConsonant
member.summary: Gets whether this is a consonant interval.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Pitch.Interval.IsPerfect
member.summary: Gets whether this is a perfect interval (unison, fourth, fifth, octave).

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Pitch.Interval.IsStep
member.summary: Gets whether this is a step (major or minor second).

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Pitch.Interval.IsThird
member.summary: Gets whether this is a third.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Pitch.Interval.IsLeap
member.summary: Gets whether this is a leap (larger than a third).

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Pitch.Interval.Inversion
member.summary: Gets the inversion of this interval.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Pitch.Interval.Name
member.summary: Gets a human-readable name for this interval.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Pitch.Pitch
member.summary: Represents a specific pitch with pitch class and octave. Middle C is C4 (MIDI note 60).

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Pitch.Pitch.PitchClass
member.summary: The pitch class (note name without octave).

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Pitch.Pitch.Octave
member.summary: The octave number. Middle C is octave 4.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Pitch.Pitch.MidiNumber
member.summary: The MIDI note number (0-127). Middle C = 60.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Pitch.Pitch.#ctor(BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Pitch.PitchClass,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a pitch from pitch class and octave.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Pitch.Pitch.FromMidi(System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a pitch from a MIDI note number.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Pitch.Pitch.Transpose(BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Pitch.Interval)
member.summary: Transposes the pitch by the given interval.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Pitch.Pitch.Transpose(System.Int32)
member.summary: Transposes the pitch by the given number of semitones.
member.param: Number of semitones (positive = up, negative = down).

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Pitch.Pitch.IntervalTo(BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Pitch.Pitch)
member.summary: Gets the interval from this pitch to another.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Pitch.Pitch.Parse(System.String)
member.summary: Parses a pitch from standard notation (e.g., "C4", "F#5", "Bb3").

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Pitch.Pitch.TryParse(System.String,BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Pitch.Pitch@)
member.summary: Attempts to parse a pitch from notation.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Pitch.Pitch.ToFlatString
member.summary: Returns the pitch name using flats.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Pitch.PitchRange
member.summary: Represents a range of pitches from low to high.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Pitch.PitchRange.Low
member.summary: The lowest pitch in the range (inclusive).

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Pitch.PitchRange.High
member.summary: The highest pitch in the range (inclusive).

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Pitch.PitchRange.Span
member.summary: The span of the range in semitones.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Pitch.PitchRange.FromMidi(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a pitch range from MIDI numbers.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Pitch.PitchRange.Contains(BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Pitch.Pitch)
member.summary: Checks if a pitch is within this range.

member.name: T:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Pitch.PitchClass
member.summary: Represents one of the 12 pitch classes in 12-TET (twelve-tone equal temperament). Uses sharps as the canonical accidental representation.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Pitch.PitchClassExtensions.Transpose(BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Pitch.PitchClass,System.Int32)
member.summary: Transposes a pitch class by the given number of semitones.
member.param: Number of semitones to transpose (can be negative).

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Pitch.PitchClassExtensions.SemitonesTo(BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Pitch.PitchClass,BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Pitch.PitchClass)
member.summary: Gets the interval in semitones from this pitch class to another. Always returns a positive value (ascending interval).

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Pitch.PitchClassExtensions.ToSharpName(BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Pitch.PitchClass)
member.summary: Gets the display name using sharps.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Pitch.PitchClassExtensions.ToFlatName(BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Pitch.PitchClass)
member.summary: Gets the display name using flats.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Pitch.PitchClassExtensions.Parse(System.String)
member.summary: Parses a pitch class from a string representation. Accepts both sharps (#) and flats (b).
member.exception: Thrown when the name is invalid.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Pitch.PitchClassExtensions.TryParse(System.String,BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Pitch.PitchClass@)
member.summary: Attempts to parse a pitch class from a string.
member.param: The parsed pitch class if successful.

member.summary: Standard note duration values relative to a whole note.

member.summary: Represents a musical duration with optional dotting and tuplet modifications.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Time.Duration.Dots
member.summary: Number of dots (0-2). Each dot adds half the previous duration.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Time.Duration.TupletNumerator
member.summary: Tuplet ratio numerator (e.g., 3 for triplets). 1 for normal.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Time.Duration.TupletDenominator
member.summary: Tuplet ratio denominator (e.g., 2 for triplets). 1 for normal.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Time.Duration.#ctor(BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Time.DurationValue)
member.summary: Creates a simple duration without modifications.

member.summary: Creates a duration with all modifiers.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Time.Duration.Beats
member.summary: Gets the duration in beats (quarter note = 1 beat).

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Time.Duration.ToTicks(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the duration in ticks given a ticks-per-beat value (PPQN).

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Time.Duration.AsTriplet
member.summary: Creates a triplet version of this duration.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Time.Duration.Dotted
member.summary: Creates a dotted version of this duration.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Time.Duration.FromBeats(System.Double)
member.summary: Creates a duration from a number of beats.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Time.Meter.Denominator
member.summary: Note value that gets one beat (4 = quarter, 8 = eighth, etc.).

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Time.Meter.Type
member.summary: Gets the type of meter (simple, compound, or irregular).

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Time.Meter.BeatCount
member.summary: Gets the number of beats in compound/irregular meters. For simple meters, returns the numerator. For compound meters, returns numerator / 3.

member.name: P:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Time.Meter.MeasureBeats
member.summary: Gets the duration of one measure in quarter-note beats.

member.summary: Gets the duration of one measure in ticks.

member.name: M:BeyondImmersion.Bannou.MusicTheory.Time.Meter.Parse(System.String)

member.summary: Converts the pattern to ticks given ticks per beat.

member.summary: Reel pattern (even eighths in groups of 4)
